alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Western Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 24 at 2:06AM MDT until October 24 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .A strong low pressure system will bring accumulating snow to the area through the mid to late morning hours. The highest accumulations will be across the northwestern Black Hills into parts of far northeast Wyoming early this morning as upslope enhanced snow increases in intensity. Winds are expected to gust from 40 to over 50 mph at times through the morning, supporting areas of blowing and drifting snow with reduced visibility. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Occasional snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Western Crook County and Northeastern Crook County. * WHEN...Until noon MDT today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
